metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12393 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
A potential vulnerability was found in 32-bit builds where an integeroverflow during the conversion of scripts to an internal UTF-16representation could result in allocating a buffer too small for theconversion. This leads to a possible out-of-bounds write. *Note: 64-bitbuilds are not vulnerable to this issue.*. This vulnerability affectsFirefox < 63, Firefox ESR < 60.3, and Thunderbird < 60.3.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12393` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 63.0+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 63.0+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 63.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '63.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
